title: URL Handler: support untitled files

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
I am able to open current file (at a specified line and column) with :
`vscode://file/C:/Users/Me/Desktop/file.py:11:1`
But I would like to be able to open a new file with something like this:
`vscode://new?text=text_that_will_be_in_file&type=js
`
This was asked [here ](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/4883)but apparently not implemented and the issue is closed so I can't comment on it. 




<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

title: Word wrapping renders spaces as first characters on a line
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

When word wrapping is enabled and the first character that does not fit on a line is a whitespace, the space is rendered as the first character on the new line. This creates a fake indentation that, while not being an issue or breaking the workflow, can be annoying. Other text editors usually don't exhibit this behaviour.

For clarity, consider this paragraph:

![vscode](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32854170/58620319-b430b980-82be-11e9-9d66-0ebed50dfee1.PNG)

The second line of the paragraph ends with "veniam, ", with the space being the first character not to fit on the line. As such, the line is wrapped just after the comma and the space is rendered as the first character on the third line. Compare it with Notepad++ (same font, same fontsize):

![npp](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32854170/58620397-e0e4d100-82be-11e9-9c7a-c6060d4ded75.PNG)

The second line would end at "veniam, " as well, but the word is wrapped after the previous whitespace, after "ad minim ", and the space between "veniam," and "quis" is still rendered.

title: Terminal URI auto decode
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version:1.33
- OS Version: macOS Mojave version 10.14.3 (18D42)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open Terminal
2. type `echo "http://example.com?a=JGPD%2B%2B%2BfS45rQEtkhKPjJw7vwCUsQ%3D"`, then `Cmd + click to follow link` in Terminal
3. in browser, it will become `http://example.com/?a=JGPD+++fS45rQEtkhKPjJw7vwCUsQ=`

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

When i use `Cmd + click to follow link` in Terminal, the URI in Firefox browser will auto decode. Is this a feature or a bug ?

title: Make `editor.gotoLocation.multiple: "goto"` state UX more discoverable
body:
**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Set `"editor.gotoLocation.multiple": "goto"`
2. `f12` on `IFileService` in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/87d3f3e77b5c7108babf8e86f70eedac5820bba2/src/vs/platform/files/common/files.ts#L20

**Request**
We currently show the navigation state in the status bar:

![Screen Shot 2019-05-29 at 2 28 22 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12821956/58592762-0b328200-821e-11e9-999a-53eea621d961.png)

This is not very discoverable the first time you use this feature. It can also be hidden if you have terrible status bar cramping:

![Screen Shot 2019-05-29 at 2 29 15 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12821956/58592841-35843f80-821e-11e9-87ab-fffd00e968c3.png)




<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: Change all occurences and Command Palette is in every editor
body:
Refs: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/74472

Notice how the context menu in the comment input box is pretty useless. It has all the unrelated actions. And we have  similar problem in the debug console input box.

I belive the Change all occurences and the Command Palette belong only in the main editor and they should be removed from all others.
@bpasero @jrieken On what context keys do we contribute these commands. Can we fine tune them so they do not appear in every editor?

![Screenshot 2019-05-29 at 15 45 02](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1926584/58562353-5f8f2f00-8229-11e9-9aec-1f8c4d6d9c0d.png)

title: comment context keys overly complex
body:
Refs: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/74472

Here are the new context keys:
commentController,
commentIsEmpty
commentThreadIsEmpty
comment
commentThread

Please add good docs for them, because they look overly complex for me and easily to confuse.
Apart from good docs I would try to use all of them in the extension sample here https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-extension-samples/tree/048fa2f156090c43cbe56bc4e2788aa77c091a5d/comment-sample

Also it is not quite clear what are the possible value for some. For example `commentThread`
Is this the whole value or just a type of it? Looking at how it is used in the sample the better name might be `commentThreadType`
Similar might apply to `comment` since its name is very general

title: It is unclear what valid values are for contextValue
body:
Testing https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/74472

It looks like from reading the doc that `editable` is a valid value. However there is no indication if this is the only valid value. And if not which the other values are.

title: Cannot expand code blocks after collapsing and closing the file
body: - VSCode Version: 1.34.0 - OS Version: macOS 10.14.5 Steps to Reproduce: 1. Open a large JavaScript file with code (classes or functions) 2. Collapses blocks 3. Close the file 4. Reopen the same file 5. Try to expand collapsed blocks. The `+` will not be showed. A `Loading...` box will be presented when hovering on the line number area. the same `Loading...` popup box is presented when hovering a variable name. The `+` glyphicon will not be showed even closing and reopening that file multiple times. Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

title: Add support to distinguish between diagnostics created by a reconciler and a builder
body:
Short summary: currently it is very hard to handle / merge diagnostics that come from to different source having the same owner. This either leads to stale problems or missing problems. For a lengthy discussion see https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/61140

Having support to distinguish between diagnostics create by a reconciler and a builder would help solve that problem.

title: [Chore] Name of the project/software
body:
## Description

A big problem with this project is its name. A lot of people are confused and confound _Visual Studio_ with _Visual Studio **Code**_. The names are far too similar and the name of the second is included in the first one.

But they are very different by nature:

- VS
  + Free or Paid, proprietary and close source software
  + IDE for C#, C++, .NET
  + Only available for Windows and macOS
  + https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/
- VSCode
  + Free, libre and open-source software (FLOSS)
  + Powerful text editor that is highly extendable aka as a better replacement for Atom.
  + Available for Windows and macOS **AND** for a lot of Linux distros
  + https://code.visualstudio.com/

## In real life

I saw ton of people refusing to use or even give a try to VSCode or **even** see what it look like only because they thought it was in fact VS (the IDE).

## Microsoft communication

MS are trying to make Visual Studio like a brand where there is several tool inside like VS (VS IDE?) and VSCode.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16578570/58507525-3e2f3400-8192-11e9-975e-2fe0a61d8aa3.png)

It's already confusing with VS and VSCode but know it is also confusing between Visual Studio (the brand) and Visual Studio (the IDE, sometimes rebranded as Visual Studio IDE).

## The logo

VS logo:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16578570/58507802-d2010000-8192-11e9-9459-322faa09da1f.png)

VS Code logo:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16578570/58507814-dc22fe80-8192-11e9-8493-74724bf808ce.png)

The logo are also very similar, VSCode is basically the logo of VS with something more and another color.

## The solution

- Forget about Visual Studio as a brand or identity
- Let the very famous Visual Studio (IDE) with it's name
- Rename Visual Studio Code with something very different (and also a different logo)
- (Please don't simply rename it as `Code` or `VSCode`, let's try something very different)

## My point of view and proposition

I'm more for something totally unbranded (like `Atom`, it was not named `Github Edit` or `Github Code`) rather than something branded a `Microsoft Edit` or `Microsoft Code` that will also be confusing in a way.

By using [acronymify](https://acronymify.com/search?q=Redefined+Modern+Rich+Intelligent+Visual+Code+Editor) with those words (Redefined Modern Rich Intelligent Visual Code Editor) if found sexy acronyms:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16578570/58508795-2ad19800-8195-11e9-842d-3693d419e1af.png)

REDMON is of course big wink but I think Rodeo could be a great editor name!

## Similar issues

I looked for existing open or closed similar issue but I didn't find one. That must has been reported before but there are too much issue to check. If you find one please link it.

title: increaseIndentPattern cannot be case insensitive
body:
VS Code version: Code 1.34.0 (a622c65b2c713c890fcf4fbf07cf34049d5fe758, 2019-05-15T21:59:37.030Z)
OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.17763

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open language-configuration.json
2. Go to indentationRules > increaseIndentPattern
3. Write something super basic like `(?i)function`
4. Writing `function` in your does not indent correctly

No matter what I write or try; having increaseIndentPattern case insensitive never works.
If I remove (?i) it works but is of course case sensitive.

Video demonstration: [video](http://hezkore.com/junk/2019-05-28_21-47-03.mp4)

title: Multi Cursor in different Files
body:
The option to have multiple cursors in different files if you have them open side by side.

At the moment you can only type in one file at a time.

title: Problems with synchronise button
body: Issue Type: Bug press synchronise button after setting gitconfig to automatic rebase for pull. The effect is that even if I have 0 commit to pull, it pulls everything before pushing, then having to deal with a ton of merge conflicts during the pull-rebase phase. The problem does not appear when I just push the commits without synchronising. VS Code version: Code 1.34.0 (a622c65b2c713c890fcf4fbf07cf34049d5fe758, 2019-05-15T21:59:37.030Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.17134

title: Notepad++ "Define your Language"
body:
There is a feature in Notepad++ that allow me to customize the display information, colors and fonts for certain types of files.

IE. I have  some .out files that show some logs that I've created in other applications. Those have certain structure, and I'd like to customize certain parts of the file so I easily can read a log while I program on other window.

title: Out of memory when keeping file open while it's being updated
body:
I have a script which updates file every second. It runs for a quite long time.
Recently I've launched script, opened file in VSCode and left for about two hours. When i came back, VSCode terminated due to the out of memory issue.
Then I've done same thing again but after about 20 minutes I've launched 'Open process exporer' command and it clearly stated that window with that file consumed a lot of memory.
I think that cause for this problem may be that VSCode keeps snapshots of file in memory for undo functionality.

- VSCode Version: 1.34.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Launch script to keep contstantly updating same file for a long time.
2. Open that file in VSCode and leave it open for a while.

fix #64459: Minimap click and drag

title: Fastest Editor
body: #### Probably not the best place to ask this but IDK anywhere else to talk to [Microsoft](https://github.com/microsoft) Devs ## Prelogue Prior to the [Microsoft](https://github.com/microsoft)'s acquisition Github was working on [Xray](https://github.com/atom/xray), a next-gen IDE that had all of the application logic completely in [Rust](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust) and treat the UI as an extremely thin layer that interacts with the app via an async channel. They also made sure to use [Typescript](https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript) for all of their UI javascript code. This combination of [Rust](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust) and [Typescript](https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript) obviously creates a beautiful, statically-typed, async, concurrent code base that are designed at the language level to be fast and guarantee memory safety. ## Why it was awesome It undoubtedly would have been able to boot many times faster and out perform any electron based IDE by a large magnitude while using a fraction of the memory. ## The Question My question is does [Microsoft](https://github.com/microsoft) have any plans of A. Reviving the [Xray](https://github.com/atom/xray) project or B. Creating a similarly IDE ## Super Reaching Also would be super cool if you considered designing such an editor that implemented [Web-view](https://github.com/Boscop/web-view) or [azul](https://github.com/maps4print/azul) so that you could continue to use typescript/javascript for the UI without requiring Electron, making the application even lighter. ## PS I believe [VSCode](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode) is very fast considering it's almost entirely written in typescript but I think it may be close to, or already is, the fastest it can be given the language that it is written in. I am asking you this today because [Microsoft](https://github.com/microsoft) the last couple of years has shown itself to be more of a forward thinking, open to open-source, and a creator of some pretty cool things (i.e. [VSCode](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode), [Typescript](https://github.com/microsoft/TypeScript), [Bosque](https://github.com/microsoft/BosqueLanguage)).

Lorem ipsum dolor, sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Molestiae ipsam eius quos voluptate hic recusandae excepturi cum. Dolores vitae sunt optio assumenda soluta aliquam numquam voluptatum modi minima, labore illo.

Lorem ipsum dolor, sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Molestiae ipsam eius quos voluptate hic recusandae excepturi cum. Dolores vitae sunt optio assumenda soluta aliquam numquam voluptatum modi minima, labore illo.

``` As you can see it provides us just a generic source.php `meta.embedded.line.phpthat` we can't target. This is sort of bug because the second curly bracket (the opening one) have a different scope.

title: Status bar items are truncated on small screens
body:
On a small screen, some items in the status bar may be truncated.

Ideally, no content would be lost, regardless of screen size.

When there isn't enough room to render all items on a single line, perhaps VS Code should wrap items instead of removing/hiding them.

For context, the biggest issue I have with this is: when I open a TS file on my MacBook screen, I can't see the initialising/loading status of TS, which usually appears in the status bar.

title: reindent selected lines and reindent lines creating selection bug
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.34.0
- OS Version: 10.14.5

**Steps to Reproduce:**

1. open a file and write a block, put a single cursor at the location indicated in the below code block.
```ts
const testFunc = () => {
  const a = 'a';
|
}
```
2. open command palette and run `Reindent Selected Lines`.
3. see there is a selection of white spaces.

Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: **Yes**

**Expected Behavior:**
1. If selections exist, keep selection after reindent lines.
2. If selections don't exist, keep empty selections (keep bare cursors).

**Current Behavior:**
1. If cursor is originally after the first non whitespace character in the line, the behavior is the above expected behavior.
2. If cursor is originally before the first non whitespace character in the line, calling these two commands creates selection of whitespaces.
